job_title: RN Work from Home New Hire Class September
job_text: ['Bring empathy and a passion for evidence-based care to all you do.', 'Multitasking and attention to detail are your superpowers.', 'You have a strong clinical background and believe part of your job as an RN is to advocate for your patients.', 'You roll with the punches on any given day, with any given interaction, and never lose sight of the need to use your stellar interpersonal and quick assessment skills.', 'You respect different cultures and know that rule-following is essential to your personal integrity and your employer’s quality compliance.', 'Work independently to make clinical decisions on routine patient care matters (at your license level)', 'Provide patient-focused care and guidance on the phone or online, including accurately assessing needs, delivering or directing to the appropriate level of care, identifying potential health problems and influencing people to make better health decisions', 'Communicate with our organization’s clients as needed and other team members, verbally and digitally', 'Monitor your own performance with dashboard metrics and look for ways to improve', 'Participate in coaching sessions to improve performance', 'Document all patient/member interactions via management software', 'A min of Three(3) years as a Registered Nurse with recent direct patient care experience; Five(5) years preferred in a high acuity level i.e. ICU, CC, ER, and or Tele - Health, Telephonic Triage.', 'Must currently reside and have an Multi - State unrestricted RN license in one of the following states: AR, CO, FL, GA, IA, LA, ME, MO, MS, NC, ND, NE, NM, OK, SC, SD, TN, TX, VA, WI', 'Ability to become licensed in additional states as required', "Minimum of an associate's degree from a two-year technical college or technical school, or diploma nursing program; Bachelor's degree preferred", 'Must provide college transcripts prior to employment', 'Full-time positions available', 'Your schedule will include at least four weekend days per month. Differential pay may be earned for certain shifts.', 'Training is 2-3 weeks, with the first two weeks being Monday-Friday. 100% Attendance is required. Training is done in a virtual, interactive classroom setting.', 'For work-from-home positions, your home office must meet certain certification requirements that would be explained to you during the interview process.', 'Being an integrity-driven organization that can truly change people’s lives', 'Serving others joyfully and individually—we’re driven by the power of personal connection', 'Pioneering next-generation healthcare consumer and clinical engagement experiences', 'An entrepreneurial mindset', 'A work/life balance']

['Help people return to the office safely. Through a track and trace app, we can push out notifications to individuals, activate requests for deep sanitation, close off access to spaces, and push people into alternate work areas with greater distance between them.', 'Help staff and patients navigate hospitals easily. Through indoor mapping and awareness, we can direct patients from their car directly to their appointments, from registration to labs, and to waiting rooms. For nurses, we can tag equipment and supplies allowing quick access to other team members, visualizing asset movement and sending notifications.', 'Increase safety within schools. Through positioning and awareness, we can push out alerts in real time if an unregistered device enters the premises and fails to obtain clearance.', 'Manage cybersecurity. Through integration with Mobile Device Management, we can detect unauthorized devices, control applications in secured zones, and uphold best practices, security policies and compliance in government, pharmaceutical, and financial agencies managing a sensitive work environment.', 'Optimize resources allocation. Through any number of our product features, we manage, prioritize, and control the way spaces are used and accessed. Whether it’s staff allocation in retail space, managing temperature and electricity consumption in a workspace, we improve space utilization.', 'Support the generation of a clear product vision. You will work directly with Developers on your team, providing Agile feature reviews to ensure creation is on track. You will create and execute manual test plans pre-production to ensure newly integrated features act and respond as they would in the real world.', 'Apply a Behaviour Driven Development paradigm. You will work with various stakeholders globally to elicit feedback and gain an understanding of needs and challenges. You will assist in the creation of product specification documents based on the findings and insights from workshops.', 'Enhancing product knowledge through collaboration. You will increase your understanding of Inpixon products and continuously grow your experience. You will actively participate in our web quality guild to share ideas and best practices with your peers. You will track project health over time via release post-mortems, regression reports, coverage numbers, etc. You will gather relevant data, perform an analysis based on specifications and create reports for the product and development teams.', 'Setting exceptional standards. You are always looking for ways to improve processes and efficiency. You will introduce best practices and tools. You will maintain the integrity of the software by asking questions and ensuring your contributions to the product are thoroughly tested, clearly documented, and provide long term sustainability. No one likes breaking changes in releases! You will hold yourself and your team accountable for reliable quality code.', 'The analytical expertise. You may have a post-secondary degree, or you may have earned your hands-on skills in an alternate way. You have 2+ years experience working in a Quality Analyst role. You can translate requirements into specifications; introducing creative and scalable solutions through research and a knowledge of best practices.', 'A commitment to efficient processes. You are always looking for ways to improve processes and you always ensure your communications have been received and are clearly understood. Your commitment and focus influence those around you to do better.', 'An Agile team approach. You use a Behaviour-Driven Development process and you thrive in an Agile environment. You are committed to your team, have fantastic communication skills, and the ability to pivot when needed.', 'A depth of technical and practical knowledge. You possess a mastery of authoring BDD-style tests via languages such as Gherkin, Gauge, JBehave, etc. You understand how both end-users and developers think, and you are always ready to brainstorm a solution that provides easy-to-use functionality for every kind of situation.']

['Help people return to the office safely. Through a track and trace app, we can push out notifications to individuals, activate requests for deep sanitation, close off access to spaces, and push people into alternate work areas with greater distance between them.', 'Help staff and patients navigate hospitals easily. Through indoor mapping and awareness, we can direct patients from their car directly to their appointments, from registration to labs, and to waiting rooms. For nurses, we can tag equipment and supplies allowing quick access to other team members, visualizing asset movement and sending notifications.', 'Increase safety within schools. Through positioning and awareness, we can push out alerts in real time if an unregistered device enters the premises and fails to obtain clearance.', 'Manage cybersecurity. Through integration with Mobile Device Management, we can detect unauthorized devices, control applications in secured zones, and uphold best practices, security policies and compliance in government, pharmaceutical, and financial agencies managing a sensitive work environment.', 'Optimize resources allocation. Through any number of our product features, we manage, prioritize, and control the way spaces are used and accessed. Whether it’s staff allocation in retail space, managing temperature and electricity consumption in a workspace, we improve space utilization.', 'Support the generation of a clear product vision. You will work directly with Developers on your team, providing Agile feature reviews to ensure creation is on track. You will create and execute manual test plans pre-production to ensure newly integrated features act and respond as they would in the real world.', 'Apply a Behaviour Driven Development paradigm. You will work with various stakeholders globally to elicit feedback and gain an understanding of needs and challenges. You will assist in the creation of product specification documents based on the findings and insights from workshops.', 'Enhancing product knowledge through collaboration. You will increase your understanding of Inpixon products and continuously grow your experience. You will actively participate in our web quality guild to share ideas and best practices with your peers. You will track project health over time via release post-mortems, regression reports, coverage numbers, etc. You will gather relevant data, perform an analysis based on specifications and create reports for the product and development teams.', 'Setting exceptional standards. You are always looking for ways to improve processes and efficiency. You will introduce best practices and tools. You will maintain the integrity of the software by asking questions and ensuring your contributions to the product are thoroughly tested, clearly documented, and provide long term sustainability. No one likes breaking changes in releases! You will hold yourself and your team accountable for reliable quality code.', 'The analytical expertise. You may have a post-secondary degree, or you may have earned your hands-on skills in an alternate way. You have 2+ years experience working in a Quality Analyst role. You can translate requirements into specifications; introducing creative and scalable solutions through research and a knowledge of best practices.', 'A commitment to efficient processes. You are always looking for ways to improve processes and you always ensure your communications have been received and are clearly understood. Your commitment and focus influence those around you to do better.', 'An Agile team approach. You use a Behaviour-Driven Development process and you thrive in an Agile environment. You are committed to your team, have fantastic communication skills, and the ability to pivot when needed.', 'A depth of technical and practical knowledge. You possess a mastery of authoring BDD-style tests via languages such as Gherkin, Gauge, JBehave, etc. You understand how both end-users and developers think, and you are always ready to brainstorm a solution that provides easy-to-use functionality for every kind of situation.']

['This role reports functionally to the Arkema Group Global Chief Technology Officer (CTO) (France) along with 5 global service line leaders, as well as locally to the CIO Arkema Americas, along with 4 other Directors, 2 Managers and 1 administrative professional.', 'This role is responsible for Infrastructure Americas team include a group 20 IT professionals: 3 Managers and 17 staff at various responsibility and skill levels. Also is responsible for leadership of vendors and contractors engaged for staff augmentation or project execution.', 'This role will evolve as a global service line leader in the coming year, including responsibility of global functional reports and their teams within this service line.', 'Arkema’s IT Organization (ITeam) is global. A standard infrastructure exists around the world. This role is an integral part of the global model and contributes as such.', 'The role will direct a global service line - Leads and or aligns global initiatives and global-regional coordination.', 'For the Americas (AMAS) – ensures AMAS region aligns with worldwide objectives, standards, and practices. AMAS refers to the entire region of the Americas (North and South America).', 'Arkema considers digital transformation as a cornerstone of its business strategy. Arkema is engaged in a cloud first strategy, SaaS, IaaS, PaaS. This role is a key contributor to evolving technology and organization in line with this strategy.', 'Globally the position will head one of Arkema’s global infrastructure service lines, which delivers services to 19,000 employees at 200+sites around the world, supporting $8B in sales. The Global Service Line Leader is charged with related technology strategy and directional roadmap as well as leadership in execution.', 'In the Americas the position is responsible for infrastructure technology assets and activities for 12 business units at 60+ sites incorporating $3 Billion in sales. Other relevant sizing in AMAS:3 Regional data centers, 450+ Servers50+ Third party warehouses24*7*365 mission critical support3,500+ PCs750+ Smart phone users, 30+ Site company standard voice systems (PBXs)4-8 significant infrastructure projects, including the rollouts of new technologies, upgrades of existing technologies, and site infrastructure upgrades and advancements', 'This position has additional IT architectural and operational responsibilities for Central and South America working directly with the respective Regional Mangers to ensure conformance to global iTeam standards, policies, and procedures.', 'Lead Global Initiatives – Define business case, align with procurement strategy, develop evaluation criteria, provisional cost estimates, select solutions, and partners. Define project organization & methodology (including transition Build-to-Run) launch and sponsor projects.', 'Manage architecture demands including application technical upgrades - understand needs, analyze architecture options and prioritize through execution.', 'Design general architecture, including functional and technical architectures, interface / API scoping, non-functional requirements e.g. security and performance.', 'Direct technology upgrades, ensure proper risk analysis and go/no-go study.', 'Event Management – Monitor services for continuous improvement, categorize and filter events to decide on appropriate actions.', 'Problem Management - Manage the technology lifecycle. Prevent incidents, and minimize impact of incidents that cannot be prevented. Proactive problem management by analyzing incident records and using data to identify trends of significant problems', 'Crisis Management - Manage crisis life cycle, coordinate stakeholders to resolve, communicate, and evaluate root cause.', 'Technical Management - Provide technical expertise and support for management of the IT Infrastructure Services', 'Review services on a regular basis, improve service quality where necessary, and identify economical ways of providing services.', 'Evaluate processes on a regular basis, monitor process performance through KPI and dashboards, identify where targeted process metrics are not reached. Develop audits, maturity assessments, benchmarks to evaluate usage of processes and tools.', 'Define specific initiatives aimed at improving services and processes. Verify if improvement initiatives are proceeding according to plan defined, Introduce corrective measures where necessary.', 'Life cycle management - Implement lifecycle management of central hardware and software solutions. Propose evolution / change / project accordingly. Suggest a life cycle process for non-centralized services (under the sites responsibility), in order to improve our management of those services.', 'Involvement in contract management, budget management and cost optimization.', 'Ensure global alignment with technology direction, initiatives and ongoing support.', 'Prioritize operations and project work and assignments internally, with clients, and across IT organizations. Coordinate deployment strategies.', 'Define and implement IT strategies, set and enforce departmental policy, develop and manage processes, procedures and tools.', 'Ensure third level incident and problem management support across all Infrastructure teams.', 'Direct and/or participate in regional and global continuous process improvement initiatives; identify improvement opportunities, propose alternatives, evaluate/select alternatives, lead implementations.', 'Development the department’s capital and expense budgets. Develop and present business case and appropriation requests for asset investments. Manage overall spend to meet department and company expectations.', 'Participate in supplier relationship management via ongoing communications, negotiations, contract reviews, and service measurement', 'Windows Server (“Back Office”) and PC (“Front Office”) technologies. Ensure Arkema’s Back and Front Office architectural standards (“NEO”) are followed consistently.', 'Develops AMAS roadmap for move to and use of cloud, in close collaboration with Applications Teams.', 'Provide consulting to regional IT teams in Mexico and South America as needed.', 'Underlying SAP software (“Basis”), Hardware/Operating Systems (IBM Power Series/AIX), inter-application data exchanges (FTP) and the Database Administration function (“DBA”). 5 SAP landscapes', 'Ensure effective contributions for SAP application-led projects and other projects requiring Basis, AIX or DBA support.', 'Data networks technologies (communications equipment and services), operational security technology (firewalls, proxies), and Cyber Security initiatives.', 'Coordinate and communicate network (Inter-site “WAN” and Intra-site “LAN”) design and deployment activities across the Americas, consistent with global standards.', 'Deliver networks and operational security technologies including regional support for the Security Operations Center.', 'Ensure relationship with datacenter colocation provider to deliver requisite services with respect to power, environmental protection, physical security, and inter-data center connectivity.', 'Ensure back up of critical Arkema data from the primary location to an alternate. Safeguard the company’s critical systems and services with focus on continuous operation in the event a disastrous occurrence in the primary regional data center or in a remote site computer room.', 'Conduct exercises to certify the propriety of the disaster recovery processes.', 'Support development of global cyber security policies and align with regional policy.', 'Minimize cyber vulnerability by ensuring vendor and/or application security assessments.', 'Direct SAP security reviews in conjunction with internal and external auditors.', 'Direct US voice/video-related services including phone systems, carrier services, mobile phones and video conference rooms.', 'Oversee carrier contract negotiations, service levels, and ongoing billing analysis for cellular, local and long distance services.', 'Ensure service for distribution and support of smart phone technology for US users.', 'Provide deployment and operational support for corporate standard PBXs.', 'Participate in global strategy development for target operating model and organization evolution.', 'Lead organizational change resulting from the evolution of applications, systems, and technology.', 'Optimize for cost and performance, internal and external resource usage.', 'Ensure workforce planning and career development with direct reports and teams via goal setting, performance management, cross training, assignments, formal education, mentoring and mobility.', 'Communicate departmental information internally and externally.', 'Foster teamwork and professional relationships amongst iTEAM groups in the Americas via group initiatives, management meetings, communications and cross functional assignments', 'Instill and maintain a “client awareness – passion for service” attitude in all team members.', 'Contribute to leadership and manage the IT impact of acquisitions and divestitures in line with the direction of Arkema business interests. Includes due diligence activities,', 'Affect the achievement of Arkema’s objectives and values via participating in or directing non-IT company projects, teams, committees, boards, projects, and management and facilitation of non-technical initiatives.', 'Role will require travel to Arkema Americas regional locations and to global iTeam locations (includes minimum of 1 trip per year to Europe). Travel estimated at 10-15% annually.', 'This position operates in a consistently evolving technical and business environment. The position requires a high level of adaptation. Business needs, requests and priorities shift as the businesses grow and advance, and the context in which they operate changes.', 'Manage in a fast-paced changing IT landscape with a focus on effective governance and control, in order to provide cost effective services and solutions.', 'Manages and operates in an international environment. Remains flexible and understanding across different cultures in relationships, communications, decision making and time zones.', 'Position proactively addresses technical problems with timely resolution and communication, fulfilling client expectations and relationships in a stressed and/or emergency environment while still maintaining standards, goals, and policies.', 'Position must assesses and manage how global and company cultures impact communication and decision making', 'Supports the site HES policy and complies with all regulatory and internal requirements', 'Participates in HES activities provided by site management and Arkema Inc. (e.g., Behavioral Base Safety, SafeStart, etc.)', 'Supports and promotes the reporting of all health, safety, environmental, near-miss, accident or injury incidents', 'Bachelor Degree required with focus in Information Technology preferred. Master’s Degree or other related technical certifications a plus.', 'Minimum of 12 years’ overall experience, including applying systems and infrastructure solutions to business needs', 'Minimum 5 years leading Infrastructure organization/team', 'Minimum 5 years project management experience, including large IT, global, and system improvement projects.', 'Broad understanding of technical/ business/ professional aspects of systems/ applications/ tools used', 'Experienced in cloud - SaaS, IaaS, PaaS setup and operations', 'Understanding of evolving digital and related cyber security technologies.', 'Direct experience with developing and implementing regional and global digital transformation initiatives', 'Working knowledge of WAN, LAN, Server OS/DB, PC HW/SW/OS and voice/data communication technologies.', 'Proven leadership and team building skills. Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills needed to work with various levels of client, management and employee.', 'Strategic thinking, ability to develop strategies while incorporating a broad organizational perspective.', 'Strong ability to work in a global context and multicultural environment. Europe, Asia, Americas, including understanding of how global and company culture impact direction and ability to consider appropriate context in decision-making.', 'Ability to recognize and anticipate political environment.', 'Accepts responsibility, responds quickly to change, able to handle multiple initiatives while meeting aggressive deadlines.', 'Strong organizational, prioritization and time management skills, able to work on multiple simultaneous dissimilar activities with focus on quality, accuracy and productivity. Ability to handle adverse situations and competing priorities.', 'Strong Influencing, negotiating, planning and risk analysis skills.', 'Strong verbal and written communication abilities – ability to oscillate between high level and details, adapting messages regionally and globally to various executives and audiences.', 'Demonstrated consultative and customer facing skills.', 'Maintain confidentiality and ensure security of critical data and processes', 'Desire and ability to share knowledge.', 'Champion iTeam and Arkema']

['Reviews Provider request for relevant and complete supporting documentation.', 'Requests additional documentation per New Century Health (NCH) policy.', 'Utilizing clinical guidelines approved by NCH Utilization Management Committee (UMC), the URN has the authority to authorize services or procedures. At no time can a URN recommend an adverse determination.', 'Ensures regulatory guidelines are met for timeliness and use of medical review criteria.', 'Verifies accuracy of codes and services and applies them accurately with appropriate documentation.', 'Establishes and maintains professional relationships with Providers and office staff for the purpose of education to establish a smooth operational flow of authorizations and referrals.', 'Educates and supports UM staff with medication requests, laboratory results and documentation of submissions per approved NCH policy guidelines.', 'Complies with current URAC standards as they relate to this position.', 'Supports clinical initiatives as identified by the UM department and UMC.', 'Assists Chief Medical Officer (CMO), Medical Reviewers and the Clinical Specialist in the submission of developed and approved pathways sent to Information Technology.', 'Assists the Director of UM, Medical Reviewers and CMO to develop report data elements necessary to track and trend utilization practices by provider, practice variation reports, reports to support quality initiatives, and elements to support NCH dashboard reports.', 'Acts with honor and integrity, serving as a role model for the company.', 'Complies with HIPAA requirements and all NCH policies and procedures.', 'Acts as an interdepartmental liaison between all NCH offices, departments, and committees.', 'Performs other duties as assigned.', 'Possesses effective verbal/written communication skills, especially via phone, with the ability to interact with various levels of personnel.', 'Able to work in a fast-paced environment, demonstrate excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and organizational skills.', 'Performs multiple tasks efficiently and accurately, have exceptional attention to detail and perform consistent work product validation/QA.', 'Self-motivated, self-directed, team oriented, and responsible, with a positive attitude and a proactive style. ['This role reports functionally to the Arkema Group Global Chief Technology Officer (CTO) (France) along with 5 global service line leaders, as well as locally to the CIO Arkema Americas, along with 4 other Directors, 2 Managers and 1 administrative professional.', 'This role is responsible for Infrastructure Americas team include a group 20 IT professionals: 3 Managers and 17 staff at various responsibility and skill levels. Also is responsible for leadership of vendors and contractors engaged for staff augmentation or project execution.', 'This role will evolve as a global service line leader in the coming year, including responsibility of global functional reports and their teams within this service line.', 'Arkema’s IT Organization (ITeam) is global. A standard infrastructure exists around the world. This role is an integral part of the global model and contributes as such.', 'The role will direct a global service line - Leads and or aligns global initiatives and global-regional coordination.', 'For the Americas (AMAS) – ensures AMAS region aligns with worldwide objectives, standards, and practices. AMAS refers to the entire region of the Americas (North and South America).', 'Arkema considers digital transformation as a cornerstone of its business strategy. Arkema is engaged in a cloud first strategy, SaaS, IaaS, PaaS. This role is a key contributor to evolving technology and organization in line with this strategy.', 'Globally the position will head one of Arkema’s global infrastructure service lines, which delivers services to 19,000 employees at 200+sites around the world, supporting $8B in sales. The Global Service Line Leader is charged with related technology strategy and directional roadmap as well as leadership in execution.', 'In the Americas the position is responsible for infrastructure technology assets and activities for 12 business units at 60+ sites incorporating $3 Billion in sales. Other relevant sizing in AMAS:3 Regional data centers, 450+ Servers50+ Third party warehouses24*7*365 mission critical support3,500+ PCs750+ Smart phone users, 30+ Site company standard voice systems (PBXs)4-8 significant infrastructure projects, including the rollouts of new technologies, upgrades of existing technologies, and site infrastructure upgrades and advancements', 'This position has additional IT architectural and operational responsibilities for Central and South America working directly with the respective Regional Mangers to ensure conformance to global iTeam standards, policies, and procedures.', 'Lead Global Initiatives – Define business case, align with procurement strategy, develop evaluation criteria, provisional cost estimates, select solutions, and partners. Define project organization & methodology (including transition Build-to-Run) launch and sponsor projects.', 'Manage architecture demands including application technical upgrades - understand needs, analyze architecture options and prioritize through execution.', 'Design general architecture, including functional and technical architectures, interface / API scoping, non-functional requirements e.g. security and performance.', 'Direct technology upgrades, ensure proper risk analysis and go/no-go study.', 'Event Management – Monitor services for continuous improvement, categorize and filter events to decide on appropriate actions.', 'Problem Management - Manage the technology lifecycle. Prevent incidents, and minimize impact of incidents that cannot be prevented. Proactive problem management by analyzing incident records and using data to identify trends of significant problems', 'Crisis Management - Manage crisis life cycle, coordinate stakeholders to resolve, communicate, and evaluate root cause.', 'Technical Management - Provide technical expertise and support for management of the IT Infrastructure Services', 'Review services on a regular basis, improve service quality where necessary, and identify economical ways of providing services.', 'Evaluate processes on a regular basis, monitor process performance through KPI and dashboards, identify where targeted process metrics are not reached. Develop audits, maturity assessments, benchmarks to evaluate usage of processes and tools.', 'Define specific initiatives aimed at improving services and processes. Verify if improvement initiatives are proceeding according to plan defined, Introduce corrective measures where necessary.', 'Life cycle management - Implement lifecycle management of central hardware and software solutions. Propose evolution / change / project accordingly. Suggest a life cycle process for non-centralized services (under the sites responsibility), in order to improve our management of those services.', 'Involvement in contract management, budget management and cost optimization.', 'Ensure global alignment with technology direction, initiatives and ongoing support.', 'Prioritize operations and project work and assignments internally, with clients, and across IT organizations. Coordinate deployment strategies.', 'Define and implement IT strategies, set and enforce departmental policy, develop and manage processes, procedures and tools.', 'Ensure third level incident and problem management support across all Infrastructure teams.', 'Direct and/or participate in regional and global continuous process improvement initiatives; identify improvement opportunities, propose alternatives, evaluate/select alternatives, lead implementations.', 'Development the department’s capital and expense budgets. Develop and present business case and appropriation requests for asset investments. Manage overall spend to meet department and company expectations.', 'Participate in supplier relationship management via ongoing communications, negotiations, contract reviews, and service measurement', 'Windows Server (“Back Office”) and PC (“Front Office”) technologies. Ensure Arkema’s Back and Front Office architectural standards (“NEO”) are followed consistently.', 'Develops AMAS roadmap for move to and use of cloud, in close collaboration with Applications Teams.', 'Provide consulting to regional IT teams in Mexico and South America as needed.', 'Underlying SAP software (“Basis”), Hardware/Operating Systems (IBM Power Series/AIX), inter-application data exchanges (FTP) and the Database Administration function (“DBA”). 5 SAP landscapes', 'Ensure effective contributions for SAP application-led projects and other projects requiring Basis, AIX or DBA support.', 'Data networks technologies (communications equipment and services), operational security technology (firewalls, proxies), and Cyber Security initiatives.', 'Coordinate and communicate network (Inter-site “WAN” and Intra-site “LAN”) design and deployment activities across the Americas, consistent with global standards.', 'Deliver networks and operational security technologies including regional support for the Security Operations Center.', 'Ensure relationship with datacenter colocation provider to deliver requisite services with respect to power, environmental protection, physical security, and inter-data center connectivity.', 'Ensure back up of critical Arkema data from the primary location to an alternate. Safeguard the company’s critical systems and services with focus on continuous operation in the event a disastrous occurrence in the primary regional data center or in a remote site computer room.', 'Conduct exercises to certify the propriety of the disaster recovery processes.', 'Support development of global cyber security policies and align with regional policy.', 'Minimize cyber vulnerability by ensuring vendor and/or application security assessments.', 'Direct SAP security reviews in conjunction with internal and external auditors.', 'Direct US voice/video-related services including phone systems, carrier services, mobile phones and video conference rooms.', 'Oversee carrier contract negotiations, service levels, and ongoing billing analysis for cellular, local and long distance services.', 'Ensure service for distribution and support of smart phone technology for US users.', 'Provide deployment and operational support for corporate standard PBXs.', 'Participate in global strategy development for target operating model and organization evolution.', 'Lead organizational change resulting from the evolution of applications, systems, and technology.', 'Optimize for cost and performance, internal and external resource usage.', 'Ensure workforce planning and career development with direct reports and teams via goal setting, performance management, cross training, assignments, formal education, mentoring and mobility.', 'Communicate departmental information internally and externally.', 'Foster teamwork and professional relationships amongst iTEAM groups in the Americas via group initiatives, management meetings, communications and cross functional assignments', 'Instill and maintain a “client awareness – passion for service” attitude in all team members.', 'Contribute to leadership and manage the IT impact of acquisitions and divestitures in line with the direction of Arkema business interests. Includes due diligence activities,', 'Affect the achievement of Arkema’s objectives and values via participating in or directing non-IT company projects, teams, committees, boards, projects, and management and facilitation of non-technical initiatives.', 'Role will require travel to Arkema Americas regional locations and to global iTeam locations (includes minimum of 1 trip per year to Europe). Travel estimated at 10-15% annually.', 'This position operates in a consistently evolving technical and business environment. The position requires a high level of adaptation. Business needs, requests and priorities shift as the businesses grow and advance, and the context in which they operate changes.', 'Manage in a fast-paced changing IT landscape with a focus on effective governance and control, in order to provide cost effective services and solutions.', 'Manages and operates in an international environment. Remains flexible and understanding across different cultures in relationships, communications, decision making and time zones.', 'Position proactively addresses technical problems with timely resolution and communication, fulfilling client expectations and relationships in a stressed and/or emergency environment while still maintaining standards, goals, and policies.', 'Position must assesses and manage how global and company cultures impact communication and decision making', 'Supports the site HES policy and complies with all regulatory and internal requirements', 'Participates in HES activities provided by site management and Arkema Inc. (e.g., Behavioral Base Safety, SafeStart, etc.)', 'Supports and promotes the reporting of all health, safety, environmental, near-miss, accident or injury incidents', 'Bachelor Degree required with focus in Information Technology preferred. Master’s Degree or other related technical certifications a plus.', 'Minimum of 12 years’ overall experience, including applying systems and infrastructure solutions to business needs', 'Minimum 5 years leading Infrastructure organization/team', 'Minimum 5 years project management experience, including large IT, global, and system improvement projects.', 'Broad understanding of technical/ business/ professional aspects of systems/ applications/ tools used', 'Experienced in cloud - SaaS, IaaS, PaaS setup and operations', 'Understanding of evolving digital and related cyber security technologies.', 'Direct experience with developing and implementing regional and global digital transformation initiatives', 'Working knowledge of WAN, LAN, Server OS/DB, PC HW/SW/OS and voice/data communication technologies.', 'Proven leadership and team building skills. Excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills needed to work with various levels of client, management and employee.', 'Strategic thinking, ability to develop strategies while incorporating a broad organizational perspective.', 'Strong ability to work in a global context and multicultural environment. Europe, Asia, Americas, including understanding of how global and company culture impact direction and ability to consider appropriate context in decision-making.', 'Ability to recognize and anticipate political environment.', 'Accepts responsibility, responds quickly to change, able to handle multiple initiatives while meeting aggressive deadlines.', 'Strong organizational, prioritization and time management skills, able to work on multiple simultaneous dissimilar activities with focus on quality, accuracy and productivity. Ability to handle adverse situations and competing priorities.', 'Strong Influencing, negotiating, planning and risk analysis skills.', 'Strong verbal and written communication abilities – ability to oscillate between high level and details, adapting messages regionally and globally to various executives and audiences.', 'Demonstrated consultative and customer facing skills.', 'Maintain confidentiality and ensure security of critical data and processes', 'Desire and ability to share knowledge.', 'Champion iTeam and Arkema']

['Serve as the primary consultant for internal clients to design and support analytics, identify and perform statistical analyses, and make recommendations on complex business issues in partnership with functional leadership.', 'Work with stakeholders to understand business objectives to design analytic models to provide data insights to best support data-driven business decisions helping to maximize our investment in people.', 'Gather and analyze data, using advanced statistical and predictive models to identify trends and root cause of problems to recommend headcount, assist in workforce planning, predict turnover, improve hiring and marketing, and other important business issues.', 'Use technology, analytical, and quantitative research tools and models to develop and analyze cross-functional data as needed. Process large amounts of text-based data using software and statistical tools.', 'Continuously learn new tools and ways to mine and visualize data. Design audience-specific presentations with consideration of visualization principles to share data in an intuitive manner.', 'Present methodology and conclusions of analyses to a variety of recipients including peers, management, and senior executive teams. Take the results of analyses and tell a story with the data to guide leaders in business decisions with the ability to explain details and high-level overviews depending on the audience.', 'Build partnerships with business leaders and with other functional analytics groups to increase awareness of available data, improve business acumen and analysis.', 'Collaborate with subject matter experts to promote data standards, quality, and governance to improve overall strategic and operational performance and insight.', 'Partner with the Reporting Organization to design, develop, and generate non-standard reports, scorecards and dashboards. Analyze the data to ensure accuracy and that the content meets business needs and requirements.', 'Access current reporting capabilities and make recommendations for improvement. Recommend and participate in the implementation of new reporting systems and assessment of new tecnology tools.', 'Partner closely with HRIS on required system functionality to collect, analyze, present data and drive data accuracy.', 'Provide guidance, training and subject matter expertise to teams and employees in asking appropriate questions, selecting the right metrics, interpreting the data and translating into actionable recommendations.', 'Utilize project management skills and indirect leadership skills to facilitate projects. ['Manage, train, and assist in hiring a team of about 12 Admissions Counselors. You will be in charge of making sure your team hits their daily, monthly goals, and quarterly goals.', 'You will also ensure that your team receives continual training within their role.', 'Motivate your team. Your team will sometimes be on the phone for 8+ hours/day and sometimes they will have 150+ dials without any conversations. It is your job to ensure they do not burn out, and that they stay focused on Verto’s mission.', 'Direct the admissions process from point of inquiry through enrollment.', 'Maintain high quality of students with a 90% start rate.', 'You are responsible for making sure that our classes fill and that our Cost Per Enrollment (CPE) is below target. You will also be responsible for making sure that your Admissions Counselors are meeting their goals and targets each month.', 'Identify red flags, recommendations, and most importantly, execute.', 'Brand Ambassador. Your team will be representing Verto and dozens of established university brands. Upholding our brands and what they stand for is of the utmost importance. You will be in charge of continual QA to make sure we are properly representing these brands, and that they are spreading accurate, current information.', 'You will ultimately be responsible for managing a productive team. This may include stepping in to make phone calls as well.', 'Maintain Verto’s CRM, database, and dashboards, fulfilling Verto’s value of transparency. Your team should know where they stand at all times.', 'Growth Advisor. Your team will be hungry to grow within Verto. They speak to Verto’s core values and the heart of the company. Help them grow to be the best possible advisor so they can eventually move into different positions within the company.', 'Provide technical support for your staff.', 'Finalize enrollment and achieve weekly, monthly, and quarterly goals.', 'Have a passion for your work! Every student and parent interaction has the potential to change a life.', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills; the ability to call, connect and interact with potential students and their families', 'Persuasive and goal-oriented, possessing an energetic, outgoing, and friendly demeanor', 'Self-motivated and self-directed', 'Bachelor’s degree or equivalent', 'Tenacity to handle rejection and continue on with a positive attitude when reaching the next potential client. Must keep in mind that every conversation is potentially a student’s first experience with Verto, and their first time hearing that their education can serve them better', 'Previous experience in Admissions, an outbound call center, sales experience, or related advising experience preferred', 'Strong computer skills, including Google suite, Excel, and CRM/Salesforce experience preferred', 'Project Management', 'First and foremost, you’re a team player. We’re a fast-moving, mission-driven startup. We care deeply about what we do, and you will too.', 'Our “3 words” resonate with you: Curious, Relentless and Service-Oriented', "You're proactive in identifying new opportunities, solving problems, and prioritizing efforts with confidence.", 'You have excellent interpersonal skills and ability to relate to diverse constituencies.', "You're organized, have some level of detail-orientation, and are a fearless experimenter.", 'Driven by meeting numbers and experience exceeding quotas, driving for results in an OKR-driven environment.', 'You are mission-driven and ready to make a significant impact to grow and scale an organization committed to changing higher education.', 'Starting at $45,000 annual salary, depending on experience', 'Unlimited vacation and sick time, with blackout dates related to the role', 'A benefits plan that includes health insurance and as soon as possible, a retirement plan']

job_title: Analytics Manager - Carbon Free Cities and States Program
job_text: ['Map greenhouse gas reduction pathways for the United States and for a subset of states, including economy-wide pathways and sector- by- sector pathways for electricity, transportation, buildings, and industry.', 'Translate greenhouse gas reduction pathways to underlying sector-specific metrics that drive emissions.', 'Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and ‘big data’ technologies.', 'Estimate the impact of proposed policies and efforts on state-level greenhouse gas emissions to identify highest impact strategies.', 'Work with partners to update an easy-to-understand dashboard interface that summarizes, for each state and sector, current and business as usual projected emissions, the necessary emissions trajectory to net zero, and the potential impact of policies on moving current emissions toward the necessary emissions trajectory', 'In collaboration with other RMI experts, create policy options by sector that will accelerate GHG reductions and help reduce the gap between the projected trajectory and necessary trajectory', 'Lead and work actively with a small, matrixed team of analysts housed across RMI programs including Electricity and Building Electrification', 'A graduate degree or equivalent experience in an applicable field such as economics, engineering (mechanical, electrical, civil, energy), environmental management, sustainability, or business (finance, international)', 'An advanced degree in in a quantitative subject such as computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics, or data science.', 'Advanced knowledge and experience working with relational databases E.G. (Postgres), query authoring (E.G. SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.', 'Ability to create and run quantitative models in a variety of platforms such as R, Python, or Matlab.', 'Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets is strongly preferred.', 'Solid experience with processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management.', 'Experience using standard tools such as Power BI, Tableau to create compelling data visualizations for stakeholders.', 'Experience using cloud-based tools for data storage and processing (e.g. Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, etc.)', 'Ability to collaborate (e.g. GitHub) and manage a small development team with tools like Trello or the like.', 'Ability to shape project strategies from inception to conclusion, with senior guidance, including determine change models, research methods, timelines, resource plans, communications plans, and stakeholder engagement.', 'Strong writing skills.', 'Coaching and motivating project team members and resolving any issues throughout project life cycle, including writing project-level reviews for junior staff.', 'Familiarity with energy, economics, and climate.', 'Understanding of greenhouse gas data and familiarity with deep decarbonization literature.', 'Ability to stick with a problem until a solution is found, but knowledge of when to ask for help.', 'Provide thought leadership with respect to the analytic applications.', 'Ability to be self-motivated and work independently.', 'Ability to listen actively, be diplomatic, and share knowledge and information well.', 'Ability to communicate your ideas clearly; Work with team members to develop project cost estimates', 'REQUIRED: 8+ years of Data Conversion Project Management experience', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Technical Management, Computer Science or closely related area', 'A minimum of eight (8) years directly related Project Management experience, preferably with teams of 5 - 15 staff including analysts, developers, QA, tech writers, and related personnel', 'Proven experience managing fixed bid, data conversion projects on time and within budget', 'Proven project planning, oversight and close-out experience for both short-term projects and longer-term programs', 'Experienced in multiple professional methodologies (PMI/PMBOK, ITIL, SDLC, Agile/SCRUM, etc.)', 'Ability to stay current on technical service and product trends', 'Strong skills with MS Office, Project, Visio, SharePoint, and JIRA', 'Must possesses superior communication skills', 'Able to balance multiple, sometimes competing tasks', 'Must possess excellent ethics and solid personal accountability', 'Be an effective relationship builder and leader', 'Experience with a Pension and Benefits fund or vendor', 'Scrum Master Certification (Certified Scrum Master, CSM) highly desired', 'PMP certification', 'PMI-ACP certification', 'ITIL v3 Certification', 'Familiarity with RFP process (technical volumes, past performance, etc.)', 'This position will require moving of up to 10 lbs. company: US Other Agencies and Independent Organizations
job_text: ["Utilizing the Court's computer application system to understand case flow management and how it impacts data reporting.", 'Assisting in generating and reviewing Family Court dashboards and reports in Business intelligence.', 'Assisting in developing login check reports to discover data anomalies.', 'Assisting in compiling reports, updating graphs, and meeting materials.', 'Job family (Series)0099 General Student Trainee', "RequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentMust submit to a background and/or security investigationMust be 18 years or olderMust be enrolled in a undergraduate or graduate school programMust commit to a minimum of 12 hours per weekMust have a minimum of 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scaleTo qualify for this position, you must submit the following:1. Résumé2. Completed Vacancy Questionnaire3. Documentation /Proof of Education (copy of unofficial college transcript)All required documentation must be submitted by the closing date of the announcement.QualificationsApplicant must be a U.S. Citizen or authorized by United States Citizenship and Immigration Service to intern in the U.S and at least 18 years old.Applicant must be enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate school program.The student must be able to commit a minimum of 12 hours per week.Applicant must have a 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale.The incumbent should be an enthusiastic and engaged professional who enjoys working with a diverse group of Court personnel and customers and lives the DC Courts' values of Accountability, Excellence, Fairness, Integrity, Respect and Transparency.Please note that authorization for the release of your adult criminal record revealing any convictions and forfeitures, and any criminal cases currently pending before the courts are required. If you are selected for the position, a criminal history records check will be conducted.EducationTo qualify based on education, upload a copy of your unofficial transcript. The transcript must show the name of the college or university, your name, the list of courses with credit hours, major(s), and grade-point average or class ranking.Education must be from an accredited institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education. Applicants should report only attendance from accredited institutions. Applicant can verify accreditations at the following website: http://ope.ed.gov/accreditation/Search.aspxAdditional informationThis position is an unpaid internship. All required information must be received by the closing date.The safety of DC Court employees, contractors, interns and the public is a top priority. In compliance with the guidelines published by the Center for Disease Control and Prevention, the Courts has maximized its telework flexibilities. The ability and readiness for interns to telework impacts operational requirements and capabilities. This includes having a personal computer, tablet or mobile device which is not shared with secure internet connectivity.While the DC Courts has a telework policy, eligibility is determined by the respective division where the position is situated within the agency.How You Will Be EvaluatedYou will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.Your resume and supporting documentation will be reviewed to ensure you meet the minimum qualification requirements for the volunteer intern program. Applicant selections are based on academic achievement, the area of study, experience, completeness and professionalism of application. The Human Resources Division refers eligible candidates to the hiring official based on current work projects and opportunities available in the District of Columbia Courts.To preview questions please click here.Background checks and security clearanceSecurity clearanceOtherDrug test requiredNo", 'Must submit to a background and/or security investigation', 'Must be 18 years or older', 'Must be enrolled in a undergraduate or graduate school program', 'Must commit to a minimum of 12 hours per week', 'Must have a minimum of 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale', 'Required DocumentsRequired DocumentsTo qualify for this position, applicants must submit the following:Résumé or curriculum vitaeCompleted Vacancy QuestionnaireDocumentation /Proof of Education (copy of unofficial college transcript or degree)Submission of all required documentation is a must by the closing date of the announcement.', 'Résumé or curriculum vitae', 'Completed Vacancy Questionnaire', 'Documentation /Proof of Education (copy of unofficial college transcript or degree)', 'BenefitsBenefitsA career with the U.S. Government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about federal benefits.No benefits are offered.Eligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time, or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.', 'The publicU.S. citizens, nationals or those who owe allegiance to the U.S.']

['Improve, upgrade and integrate tools per strategic planEngage members in evolving and executing on the Higg Index Roadmap being created in the current strategic planning process that will outline our path for embedding sustainability measurement and analysis in member organizations. Revisit the Roadmap regularly to recognize new opportunities as we discover and prioritize them.Implement the SAC strategy through honest and collaborative relationships. Work to become a trusted and valued partner with other functions in the SAC, sister organizations, partners and membership. Become a face and voice for what is needed to fulfill the SAC’s purpose.Build and maintain a high level of proficiency on each of the Higg Index tools. Use the knowledge of the tools, content, scoring and linkages, in managing the relationship with Higg Co.Lead the coordination of the activities between the Higg Index Team and Higg Co to implement improvements per aligned processes.Deliver business value: creating, updating, and promoting a suite of integrated Higg Index tools designed to assist our membership in meeting the SAC purpose.Use intelligence gained from member and user input, scoring data analysis, subject matter experts and Higg Co platform improvements to execute on an integrated tool roadmap.Focus on fast and efficient updates/changes to the Higg Index. Reduce dependence on member driven working groups. Use membership councils for high level reviews and alignment with strategic goals. Provide leadership in developing and updating execution plans (organizational and financial) with senior management and staff.', 'Create consumer-facing and public informationDevise and implement a system for using Higg participation, scoring, validation and transparency to provide reliable B2C information.Ensure integrity: integrating metrics and building confidence in our data so we can credibly focus and communicate our efforts and build the Higg brand globallyUse data from the tools to create industry metrics, develop footprints and measure progressAdd value to users by obsessing over the consumer experience to make the Higg ecosystem the most frictionless answer to the customers social and environmental measurement and impact reduction needs.', 'Expand the ecosystem - Actively coordinate/consolidate the tools of sister/partner organizations to create a seamless ecosystem of tools and services that simplify the user experience while reducing duplicity.Work across the organization to improve transparency to ensure we work and deliver against our goals more effectively and professionally (internally and externally).Assist in developing and integrating a decision-making hierarchy and working group taxonomy so that issues and opportunities get appropriately addressed by the right people in a fair, transparent, and timely manner.', 'Lead the Higg Index virtual team - Work to develop a culture that provides a healthy, inclusive and inspiring environment for the Higg Index team, especially while working remotely. Lead by example while providing autonomy whenever possible. Be a coach, mentor, cheerleader and defender. Provide development and growth opportunities for all. Encourage challenging conversations then commit to the path forward.Anticipate challenges and obstaclesConsistently inspire excellenceManage day-to-day operations of the Higg Index teamDevelop risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans with incomplete informationBuild a transparent environment that supports constructive criticism and continuous improvementEnsure we have fun and maintain our work/life balance while delivering on our promises', 'Be an SAC leader - Learn all aspects of how the organization works, understand the issues and opportunities in all areas. Seek opportunities to grow your experience beyond your areas of expertise.Develop and maintain sound financial practices – work with senior and finance management, finance committee, and the board in preparing and executing to a board approved budgetDevelop internal systems to support long-term sustainability of the organizationPrioritize opportunities to deliver the most value to employees, members or the industryCoordinate between teams to ensure we are moving towards our organizational-level goals and staying on our scheduled timelineCreate effective communication channels that produce feedback loops for strengthening our processes, products, and personal developmentFoster collaboration: creating a fun and open environment that encourages cross-discipline problem-solving and professional developmentUtilize performance management review process that focuses the work; build accountability; and foster professional developmentCreate regular touch-bases, brainstorms and workshops to remain in sync and aligned on how to address issuesDevelop a dashboard of KPIs to measure team and organizational successMaintain a leading working knowledge of significant developments and trends in the industry value chain and related fields', 'Direct experience with SAC tools, the SAC organization and the apparel, footwear and textile industries. Contributed to the increased professionalism of the organization by working collaboratively with teammates and stakeholders to ensure that processes and systems are robust and executed while honoring SAC’s culture of innovation.', '15+ years of previous business leadership positions with direct responsibility for delivery and expansion of products or initiatives with similar complexity and financial management responsibility as the Higg Index', 'Proven team leadership experience by building healthy and thriving culture in a team especially when geographically dispersed', 'Strong experience and passion for implementing and leading sustainability focused efforts', 'Innate curiosity and ability to check their ego at the door', 'Ability to work autonomously, with a high-degree of maturity, personal integrity and self-motivation', 'Motivation by the mission of the organization and knows that success comes through teamwork and strong relationships with coworkers and members.', 'Proactive understanding of the implications of their actions.', 'Ability to work equally effectively across a variety of technical marketing, membership, finance, operations, communications and external arenas', 'Bias for keeping the customer first and building solutions that provide unexpected value', 'Educational and diverse work experience to provide well rounded, wholistic approach to creating solutions', 'Built strong community with users while growing multiple internal teams', 'Strong verbal, written, analytical, and interpersonal skills', 'Professionalism, empathy and the ability to work as part of a team, maintain a sense of humor, and interact with a diverse array of people from all over the world', 'International team management and experience required', 'Willingness and ability to engage in regular domestic and international travel', 'Answer the following four questions in 150 words or lessWhat is your involvement with and use of the Higg Index?How has your education and career prepared you to be the VP of Higg Index?What is your vision for the SAC as we embark on a new strategic plan?How do you lead, from team level to cross industry collaboration?', 'Resume and a brief cover letter including your salary requirements.', 'Links to articles you have written or in which you are referenced, recordings of presentations or public speaking']

['Prepare a Task Order Management Plan describing the technical approach, organizational resources and management controls to be employed to meet the cost, performance and schedule requirements throughout task order execution.', 'Project Manager shall meet weekly with the COR to discuss work in task areas and problem areas. ['Serves as the key subject matter expert on topics related to data management activities including specific activities and processes in early clinical development phases. Contributions include, but are not limited to: vendor selection and management, mentoring junior staff, training team members, leading or contributing to expert working groups (e.g., QSD initiatives), presenting best practices at internal and external industry meetings meetings/congresses, and participating in due diligence assessments.', 'Assumes operational and/or oversight responsibility as Study Data Manager for all assigned internal and outsourced studies, and apply Data Management best practices', 'Accountable or a contributor for CDM deliverables from protocol creation until release of data for analysis.', 'Ensure CDM input and contributions to Risk Management (risk identification, risk communication, incorporation of risk in risk management plan, implementation of risk mitigation activities in relevant plans)', 'Incorporates and maintains Medical Standards in clinical studies for all elements of the medical standards package.', 'Documents all activities adequately for all assigned studies according to SOPs and takes a lead role in QC activities, which includes, but is not limited to: initiating the documentation, maintaining document management systems, coordinating and ensuring contributions from relevant functions, requesting a timely QC of the documentation, informing relevant functions of results and ensuring proper communication between functions, QC manager and self so that all issues are reconciled.', 'Specifies and develops study specific eCRFs, data consistency checks based on Medical Standards, the Clinical Study Protocol and input from the study team.', 'Prepares, tracks and implements standard plans (i.e., Project Plan, Data Management Plan, Operational Oversight Plan, etc.) to ensure proper governance of data management study set-up, conduct and closure activities.', 'Accountable for data management activities necessary for the establishment of subject validity and analysis set assignment, including but not limited to the following: specification of important deviations and validity findings, planning and conduct of interim and final Blind Review Meeting, preparation and completion of the final Blind Review Report.', 'As applicable, plans and tracks data contributions of specialized functions typically used for early clinical development activities like Pharmacokinetics, Biomarker, Bioinformatics, Pharmacometrics, as well as strategic operational partners.', 'As applicable, establishes data management best practices for data generated in relevant research activities which may be needed in later project activities like decision making processes and submissions. This includes but is not limited to the following: support of setting data standards compatible with development standards, support of central storage and inventory, supporting data transfer activities from external vendors, supporting integration with data generated in clinical phases of development.', 'Supports study data management and data cleaning processes on an ongoing basis, applying study specific documents and conventions.', 'Identifies and issue queries, incorporate query replies and track query status.', 'Contributes to projects and initiatives aimed at improving and optimizing the delivery of DMAR, DS&A, Portfolio & Operations, OSBU.', 'Performs duties in compliance with SOPs, GCP and ICH guidelines in accordance with regulatory, legal and ethical standards.', 'Ensures complete, accurate and timely documentation for all projects/studies according to established SOPs.', 'Represents CDM as the Core Study Team member for internal and outsourced studies, and coordinates the DM Team in any aspect.', 'Tracks and leads project-level data management activities: manage PDM Teams/Early PDM Teams efficiently; ensures the timely delivery of high-quality study databases and smooth operation of SDM teams; identifies issues, defines and directs resolution measures; reports progress and escalate issues into management.', 'Manages cross-functional team memberships and interfaces effectively: closely aligns activities with Statistics function applying the 2-Lead model principles, serves as CDM member of the core Clinical Team or Early Clinical Team (as applicable).', 'Works closely with clinical and safety experts in the definition, preparation and review of reports that are critical to ensuring the quality, accuracy and completeness of analyses on study safety, medical coding and Pharmacovigilance data.', 'Establishes and tracks data management activities in co-operation with Pharmacokinetic department and Pharmacometrics department, with internal research functions like Biomarker and Bioinformatics, and with strategic external partners.', 'Develops robust and productive relationships with internal and external business partners: treats others fairly and with respect; manages conflicts constructively; provides timely and relevant feedback.', 'Make a direct impact in the lives of patients', 'Become successful in the position with exceptional training', 'Join a high-energy and team-driven workplace', 'Open up new opportunities for career growth', '6+ years of Clinical Data Management experience and at least 5 years of leading studies in a CRO setting. Combination of CRO/Pharma is acceptable.', 'Bachelor’s degree; additional relevant work experience considered in lieu of degree.', 'Full Experience including study start up, initiation, close out etc.', 'Demonstrated skill for technical management of studies with 5+ staff.', 'Experience with Database Build; eCRF creation; UAT experience.', 'Demonstrated mentoring/delegation, communication and interpersonal skills']

company: Research Foundation of The City University of New York
job_text: ['Coordinating evaluation initiatives involving multiple team members and stakeholders.', 'Collaborating with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), Instructional Designers and a team of ACS and CUNY colleagues to create, review, and pilot knowledge tests.', 'Conducting test item analyses and collaborating with SMEs to identify test item improvements.', 'Assisting in the development of instruments to measure program fidelity, simulations, etc.', 'Conducting focus groups and interviews.', 'Conducting quantitative and qualitative data analysis utilizing software such as Qualtrics, Excel, SPSS, and/or Stata.', 'Creating and maintaining dashboards in Qualtrics to inform program monitoring, performance management, and continuous quality improvement.', 'Organizing and managing data files. Maintaining detailed documentation on all data management decisions and technical work.', 'Presenting findings to diverse audiences in both oral and written formats.', 'MSW/MA/MPA/MS in social work, social science, public administration, data analytics, data science, data/information management, or another related field.', 'At least 2 years of experience doing data management and data analysis in an applied setting.', 'Experience in project management including assuring project milestones are met on time and collaborating with multiple stakeholders', 'Excellent time management and organizational skills.', 'An exceptional commitment to accuracy and attention to detail.', 'Ability to work on a team, as well as independently.', 'High degree of flexibility and maturity to work in an innovative, fast-paced environment, and to readily embrace change.', 'Strong written and oral communication skills and ability to effectively convey complex and data-related concepts to a variety of technical and non-technical audiences.', 'Sensitivity and experience working with diverse cultural and linguistic populations.', 'Ability to travel between program locations in NYC to observe, collect data, and support team members.', 'Competent and/or certified in Qualtrics Research Core, Employee Engagement, or Customer Engagement platforms is highly desired.', 'An understanding of human or social services, particularly the child welfare and juvenile justice systems is a plus.', 'Experience with data visualization using dashboards and developing infographics is a plus.', 'Expertise in evaluating unique learning experiences such as live simulations with actors or virtual reality experiences is a plus, but not required.']

['Oversees a population health vendor tasked with supporting the care journey for members with renal disease. Ensures robust vendor relationships are developed, effective communication channels are maintained, vendor-led activities are aligned with broader Independence goals (e.g. clinical excellence, member experience, provider collaboration) and vendor-led programs deliver expected results. To this end:', 'Oversees contract negotiations, including the definition of service level agreements and the development/implementation of reimbursement strategies designed to drive best in class vendor support.', 'Ensures ongoing vendor performance monitoring strategies are established, utilizing vendor performance dashboards, scorecards or other reports to promote the necessary transparency across key stakeholders.', 'Also ensures performance improvement and recovery plans are developed, issued, and tracked and managed, as appropriate.', 'Communicates strategic direction to team to support planning, prioritization, resource allocation and general decision making.', 'Delineates areas of accountability and performance expectations.', 'Coaches, mentors and evaluates direct reports and other associates.', 'Identifies performance gaps as well as gaps in individual and team skill sets required to support the achievement of kidney care goals and objectives.', 'Addresses these gaps through selective hiring, provision of developmental opportunities and, as appropriate, implementation of redeployment and exit strategies.', 'Monitors and intervenes to ensure that team has adequate “bench strength,” and that succession plans are developed and effectively executed for key positions within the team.', 'Creates a team culture and sets expectations around behavior that foster and support Independence’s Mission, Vision and Core Values.', 'Plans and oversees the activities of direct reports tasked with engaging network providers to ensure that work efforts are geared toward 1) supporting the identification and promulgation of best practices in renal care delivery and 2) identifying and addressing opportunities to improve outcomes at both the individual provider and network level. In support of ongoing network engagement and performance improvement, also works cross-functionally to drive the development, implementation, communication and management of provider performance metrics. Establishes shared savings and other provider-focused incentive programs designed to optimize outcomes.', 'Works with direct reports and cross-functionally to ensure that key capabilities are developed and maintained in support of established goals and objectives. These capabilities include but are not limited to data analysis, process analysis, vendor and ROI evaluations and project management techniques. Deploys these capabilities and proactively collaborates with key functional areas (e.g. HVO, Medical Affairs, Provider Contracting & Reimbursement, IX, Actuarial, P&Ls, Legal, Compliance and Operations) to assess and vet ongoing program activities, proposed program enhancements, prevent and resolve problems, and support initiatives designed to improve performance for key metrics associated with the program.', 'Supports the development of CCT’s long-term strategy and vision within the context of FHN-specific and broader Independence strategy, goals and objectives.', 'Hires and maintains qualified staff', 'Performs other duties as assigned.', 'The candidate must have a bachelor’s degree (Masters or above preferred) or equivalent work experience. Minimum 5 years supervisory/management experience and 7-10 years’ experience in increasingly complex assignments focused on provider relations, vendor management and/or population health. Prior experience related to renal care delivery required.', 'The candidate must have excellent leadership, interpersonal and communication skills. The candidate must also have excellent organizational and analytical skills and a strong internal and external customer focus. The candidate must be able to identify, recruit, retain and develop management-level staff; develop positive working relationship with senior (direct and above) level staff in other functional areas and adapt quickly and easily to a rapidly changing business environment.', 'A trained nephrologist with above skills would be preferred, though strong candidates without clinical backgrounds will be considered as well.']
